result.markdown:
---
title: "Art"
title-block-banner: true
page-layout: full
freeze: true
filters:
   - lightbox
lightbox: auto
echo: false
---


## Chilmark

Here is a simple image with a description. This also overrides the
description position and places it to the left of the image.

![Beach in
Chilmark](photos/images/mv-0.jpg){description="Chilmark has a reputation as having some of the best beaches on Martha's Vineyard. Chilmark beaches are resident only in the summer, so be sure to have your proof of residency ready if you'd like to visit one of these special places. _credit:_ [Chilmark Beach](https://unsplash.com/photos/VBDJGOMCwps)"
desc-position="left"}

## Elsewhere

The below demonstrates placing more than one image in a gallery. Note
the usage of the `layout-ncol` which arranges the images on the page
side by date. Adding the `group` attribute to the markdown images places
the images in a gallery grouped together based upon the group name
provided.

::: {layout="[[1, 1], [1]]"}
![Aquinnah](photos/images/mv-1.jpg){group="elsewhere"
description="The waves break off the coast of Aquinnah on a beautiful summer day."}

![Oak Bluffs](photos/images/mv-3.jpg){group="elsewhere"
description="Oak Bluffs is famous for its Gingerbread cottages, busy town center, and party like atmosphere."}

![Vineyard lighthouse](photos/images/mv-2.jpg){group="elsewhere"
description="The Edgartown Lighthouse is a short walk from downtown and has beautiful views over the entrance to Edgartown Harbor."}
:::

## With computation code chunks

Options for lightbox can be passed using chunk options.


::: {.cell lightbox='{"group":"r-graph","description":"This is 1 to 10 plot"}'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![Simple demo R plot](example_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell lightbox='{"group":"r-graph","description":"We see our cars data above"}'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![Plot about cars data](example_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


It is possible to create several plots, and group them in a lightbox gallery. Use list in YAML for options when you have several plots, on per plot.

::: {.cell lightbox='{"group":"cars","description":["This is the decription for first graph","This is the decription for second graph"]}'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![Caption for first plot](example_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Caption for second plot](example_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::


When `lightbox: auto` in main YAML config, you can opt-out lightbox on a plot by setting `lightbox: false`


::: {.cell lightbox='false'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![mtcars](example_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
